result.execSummary:
The defendant Kassandra M Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.
Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.

May terminate probation after 6 months if deemed appropriate by agent. Court allows defendant time to report to DOC. 
Maintain employment and/or school combination. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. 
**Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt: Affidavit of Services for Court appointed counsel and billing statement, received and filed, by Atty Babe.
letter from 16th Street Community Health Centers
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Kassandra M Johnson in court with Attorney Katie Elizabeth Babe.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Grant Scaife appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #1.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Babe makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  WITHHELD SENTENCE

TERM OF PROBATION:  1 YEAR     *May terminate after 6 months if deemed appropriate by agent*
 
CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed/sign releases
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 

COSTS:  $243.00 & $200.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of probation)

** Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.**

***Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.***

NOTE:  Court allows Defendant to end of business day on Friday, December 2, 2016 to report to Department of Corrections for probation.
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 1, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Kassandra M Johnson in court with Attorney Katie Elizabeth Babe.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Grant Scaife appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Babe requests an adjourned date for plea and sentence.  Court adjourns.   Bail remains as fixed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 1, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Defendant Kassandra M Johnson in court with Attorney Katie B. Bricco.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Bricco states that Defendant no longer qualifies for public defender representation and requests that this case, as well as Defendant's other case in court today,  have a court appointed attorney.  Court grants request and orders appointment of counsel.  Defendant to pay for such counsel at rate of $50.00 per month, commencing 6/1/16 until paid in full.  Court withdraws Attorney Bricco as attorney of record.  Court sets adjourned date.   Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for June 10, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Hearing on May 6, 2016 at 10:00 am.
to appear filed by Attorney Katie Bricco
